p: In the past two decades, coronaviruses have caused three epidemic diseases: SARS-CoV2 ( Zhou et al., 2020), the severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) ( Rota et al., 2003) and the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) ( Zaki et al., 2012). They have been, and in some cases continue to be, a threat to human lives, mainly triggering severe infections that are the leading causes of death, as communicated by the World Health Organization (website: https://www.who.int/).
